intro: Critesion jubatum subsp. breviaristatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed jubatum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
